usefulItems: nut milk bag or muslin cloth, large bowl, bowl, baking paper, pastry brush, large baking tray, oven
title: Cauliflower and ricotta pizza bases with blue cheese, pear and prosciutto

ingredients.content: 500 g cauliflower, cut into small florets
80 g Parmesan cheese, crust removed and cut into pieces (3 cm)

preparations.content: Place milk into mixing bowl and heat <b>15 min/80°C/speed 2<b>.
Add vinegar and heat <b>7 min/90°C/speed 1<b>. Allow to sit in mixing bowl for 2 minutes. Milk will separate into curds and whey.

Line simmering basket with a nut milk bag or muslin cloth and set over a large bowl. Pour mixture into simmering basket and allow to drain for 30 minutes. Do not squeeze liquid from ricotta. Set drained ricotta (approx. 300-340 g) aside in a bowl. Clean and dry mixing bowl.
Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a large baking tray with baking paper and set aside.

Place cauliflower into mixing bowl and chop <b>4 sec/speed 5<b>. Transfer onto lined baking tray and bake for 15 minutes (200°C), stirring every 5 minutes to ensure cauliflower doesn't burn. Set aside and leave to cool slightly. Rinse and dry mixing bowl. Reduce oven temperature to 180°C.
Place Parmesan cheese into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add cooled cauliflower, egg and 80g of the reserved ricotta and mix <b>6 sec/speed 6<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then mix <b>6 sec/speed 6<b>.
Spread cauliflower mixture onto lined baking tray, forming 1 large or 2 smaller pizza bases. Bake for 20-25 minutes (180°C), until lightly golden. Allow to cool slightly.
Brush pizza bases with oil. Top pizzas with sliced pear, blue cheese and prosciutto, then bake for 5-10 minutes (180°C), until cheese has melted. Top with rocket and serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Use any combination of toppings you like on your pizza.
Save the extra ricotta to use in pasta bakes, as a filling for baked mushrooms or in calzones.
